title: HI SOMEONE FROM GOLDBERG AND ASSOCIATES CALLED ME SAYING I OWE PAYDAY LOAN YES PAY OR GET SUED FOR 2100 GARNISHMENT I GOT 24HOUR
question: TO CALL OR WILL GET SERVED AT JOB OR HOME IF I LOSE I WILL OWE 2100 I DID GET A LOAN FROM THEM YEARS AGO I LIVE IN CALIFORNIA I PAID SOME BACK BUT GOT DELIQUENT IT WAS TAKEN OUT IN 2008 WHAT DO I DO CALL A PREPAID LAWYER TOMORROW OR MAKE ARRANGEMENTS TO PAY WHEN I CAN I DONT KNOW WHEN I WILL HAVE THE MONEY TO MAKE ARRANGEMENTS IM SCARED
answers: A lot of times, these types are just trying to scare you. If it was 2008 since your last payment, look into the local statute of limitations. Payday loan people usually just bark but really don't bite.

They are deliberately trying to scare you. It is a violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act to use any sort of misrepresentation to collect a debt. This includes making a threat to sue when the collector does not intend to file a lawsuit.

You should get identifying information about the collector, name of person, name of company, address (street address not just a PO Box), telephone number, fax number. Write, do not call, to dispute the debt and to request validation. It would be best if you got a lawyer to advise you and to assist you.

If they were to sue you, you should file an Answer within 30 days. Then it will be about a year before you will get a trial. They will need to bring witnesses to court and prove their case. A whole lot of expense and inconvenience for them and if they lose, they may end up paying your attorney's fees.

The lawyer who you consult should be experienced in debt collection matters and in suing debt collectors who violate the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act.

Richard Scott Lysle

PS Do not pay a penny. If you make any sort of payment, it will re-start the Statute of Limitations. If the Statute of Limitations has passed, you have a complete defense to the case and can make them pay your attorney's fees.

It is possible that this is a scam. there has been a great deal of scam activity surrounding old payday loans.

Before you pay any money, you can exercise your rights under the federal Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Deamdn written documentation of your obligation. If the caller ramps up the abuse, you may well have a scammer on the line.

Your interests will be best seved by consulting with an attorney who handles FDCPA cases in your area. Do so without delay.

Best wishes for a favorable outcome, and please remember to designate a best answer.
